medical_history.chief_complaint: Foot edema, proteinuria (2.9 g/gCr), and hematuria (20-29/high-power field).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms slowly developed at 28 years old. Initially, she experienced foot edema, proteinuria, and hematuria. After diagnosis, she was started on oral steroids (prednisolone, 30 mg/day), leading to improvement in proteinuria to 0.6 g/gCr.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was diagnosed with Crohn's disease at 19 years old and treated with mesalazine and salazosulfapyridine. At 21 years old, she was treated with adalimumab (40 mg subcutaneously every 2 weeks).
